  • ARC XY Memory Example

ARC XY Memory Example¶

Overview¶

This example is designed to show how to use DesignWare® ARC® processors XY memory and Address Generation Unit (AGU) which can accelerate the DSP application.

Detailed Description¶

  • Extra Required Tools

    NO

  • Extra Required Peripherals

    NO

  • Design Concept

    This example is designed to show how to use DesignWare® ARC® processors XY memory and Address Generation Unit (AGU). The job is to add DAT_SIZE uin32_t number, i.e. c = a + b. Two approaches are adopted to do the job, one tradition way and one accelerated by xy memory

Note

Hardware support: all DesignWare® ARC® processors based platform with XY memory and AGU configured. If not configured, the consumed cycles of two approaches are the same.

Building and Running¶

Taking EM Starter Kit as example, the commands to run this example are as follows:

$ cd <embarc_root>/example/baremetal/arc_feature/xymem
$ make BOARD=emsk BD_VER=22 CUR_CORE=arcem9d TOOLCHAIN=gnu run

Note

Make sure you have selected the correct configuration of EM Starter Kit via dip switches and that you have reset the board (button above “R”).

embARC Build Time: Jan  7 2019, 14:22:51
Compiler Version: Metaware, 4.2.1 Compatible Clang 6.0.1 (branches/release_60)
add with xy ccm for 1024 numbers : 2093 cycles
add for 1024 numbers : 5153 cycles

Note

Make sure you have chosen correct COM port and set the baud rate to 115200 before you start.
